text: the world must prepare for a potential
coronavirus pandemic that's the warning
from the head of the World Health
Organization over the past few hours
fresh cases have been confirmed in
countries around the globe
the number of cases worldwide of the new
corona virus is now more than 80
thousand across 36 countries China has
77,000 658 confirmed cases and an
additional two thousand eight hundred
and twenty four suspected ones but
significant clusters have developed in
South Korea Japan and Iran South Korea
plans to test 200,000 members of a
religious sect at the center of the
outbreak there while 11 people have now
died from the virus in the country and
the number of confirmed infections is
close to 1,000 in the last hour Iran's
deputy Health Minister has tested
positive for the virus in Europe Austria
and Croatia have reported their first
cases from Italy Japan and Singapore our
correspondents have the very latest
let's begin with our correspondent
Bethany Bell in Italy the scene of the
continents largest outbreak here in
Milan you can feel the impact of the
fears about the coronavirus the Duomo
the cathedral behind me has been closed
to tourists no masses are taking place
there's been an impact on the Milan
Fashion Week at the moment and over in
Venice which should be celebrating the
climax of the very famous Venice
Carnival those celebrations as well have
been stopped because of fears of the
virus spreading a cluster of towns in
Lombardy and also a couple in Veneto
about involving about 50,000 people have
been quarantined where and this is an
area where they had a spike in the
number of cases the authorities are
hoping that if they can try and keep
people from moving out of those towns
they may try and be able to halt the
spread of this disease
meanwhile though it seems to be
spreading to other countries in Europe
just over the border in Austria
officials have confirmed the first two
cases we understand to have been
occurred in Austria itself two people in
the state of Tyrol this is something
which certainly here in Italy is
creating a great deal of concern we've
just come from the area close to the
quarantine zones that people there are
nervous some people say that the
government has not reacted quickly
enough and they say it's very important
that people should stick to these
measures other people say this is
perhaps somewhat of an overreaction and
that panic is the thing that people have
to be the most afraid of
well the authorities here are growing
increasingly concerned about a rising
number of cases until now the picture in
Japan has largely focused on the cruise
ship the diamond princess which is still
more incidentally just down the coast in
the port of Yokohama although the vast
majority of passengers have now
disembarked after one over two weeks in
quarantine but separate to the 700 or so
cases linked to that ship the Japanese
authorities now say there are around a
hundred and fifty reported cases
elsewhere in the country they're dotted
all over and the concern really for the
health authorities here is that they're
really struggling as are of course many
foreign governments to try and work out
how and where those people became
infected it is a an increasing problem
it's a big headache of course for the
Japanese authorities because in five
months time Tokyo is due to host the
2020 Olympics at the moment the Health
Ministry here has said that it's too
early to start talking about
cancellations but they are concerned and
they are now saying that the next couple
of weeks will be crucial as to whether
the outbreak here can be contained and
of course they're looking over the water
at South Korea at a situation which the
South Korean president this morning
described as very grave indeed he of
course was visiting the southern city of
Daegu which is at the epicenter of the
outbreak there so as I say a lot of
alarm here in Tokyo you'll notice people
wandering around on the street behind me
most of them starting to wear face masks
now after the Japanese government
announced today guidelines for people
who are starting to feel ill telling
them they should stay at home trying to
close schools if an infection and is
revealed there and really I think
gearing up for the preliminary stages of
trying to control what they fear could
be a much bigger outbreak well Asian
markets saw mixed fortunes on Tuesday
but heavyweight in seeds like japan's
nikkei tumbled more than 3% at the close
because investors there and frankly
across the region are worried about what
might be a prolonged impact from the
coronavirus now that says cases appear
to spread around the world and i think
it would be fair to say that a new
reality has set in for many investors
who are now beginning to realize that
the spike in the number of deaths and
infections from the virus has spread
outside of China and it's increasingly
looking like this could be a global
epidemic now up till this point there
had been this sense that if China could
keep the virus contained within its own
borders then yes of course the economic
impact would be severe but it could also
be contained supply chains there would
be hit of course because so much of the
world's products are made in China but
most analysts that I talked to had said
look this will be a short-term blip and
the expectation was that when China gets
back to what then things should begin to
recover but now and here's the worry
that with cases popping up elsewhere and
containment measures including
quarantines are starting to be put in
place that means people aren't leaving
their homes they're not heading to the
shops so consumption visitor arrivals
all of that could be affected those
concerns are adding to the nervousness
of many Asian investors who are already
very worried about this illness which is
why we saw some sharp falls in markets
on major indices in the region this
Tuesday with krishma the swanee ending
that updates from our correspondents
around the world while over in South
Korea president moon jae-in has been
visiting the city of Daegu now of course
that is where more than half the
country's confirmed cases have been
found he advised residents there to stay
indoors but he did promise to avoid the
restrictions that China had imposed on
its epicenter of the coronavirus Wuhan
so long
the situation is very grave and
therefore the declaration of a special
disaster zone is not enough
general what's important is time and
speed there must be a clear turning
point witness this week in the upward
trend in the number of infections well
let's talk now to our correspondent Nora
Becca who is in Daegu the center of the
outbreak in South Korea and that
reassurance there Laura but it's
difficult isn't it because of course
there is a there are a huge number of
people who could potentially have the
virus I've been here for three to four
days now and all I've heard is staff
trying to reassure me that they're
trying to get this outbreak under
control but and today is the first day
where I've heard medic is kind of look
at me and go we're not sure we can do
that the reason is because this is
becoming far more widespread now when
the president arrived just this
afternoon he went to thank medics he
said that they've been doing a tough job
but just as he was doing so not only
rather a number of protesters outside
shouting at him to save Daegu a letter
from a leading doctor in the region
asked him for more medics he made a plea
for the 5,700 doctors in the region to
come to the hill hospitals treating
coronavirus parents patients to try to
help them know the reason is he says
that many of his staff are being put in
quarantine after becoming infected or at
least coming near an infected patient
and he said that his staff were passing
out with exhaustion so there is a clear
need for more medics to help secondly
when it comes to the spread of this yes
around half of those infected belonged
to one secretive sect known as the shin
chon G search of Jesus the race is now
on to find all of these people but there
are other areas of concern a Korea near
cabin crew member now has the virus
another megachurch share which is based
in seoul the world's largest
Presbyterian Church two of its number
now have the virus there are certain
areas and pockets including the military
where 13 soldiers have it in different
provinces so while these cases keep
cropping
it means that the authorities here have
to keep tracing them and trying to find
out where the outbreak source for is
okay Laura Beckett thank you very much
indeed
